title.narrative: Yemen: Second Basic Education Development Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to assist the Government of Yemen in improving student learning and equitable access to basic education in selected governorates and schools.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition | Description :Basic Education Coordinator, Early Grade Reading Focal Point andEducation Research and Development Center Technical Coordinator have been appointed with tasks, responsibilities and qualificationssatisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-Mar-2013
Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition | Description :The Project Operations Manual (POM) has been adopted by the MOE in amanner satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-Mar-2013

target.value: Cumulative evaluation and revision of teaching and learning materia

actual.value: Grade 2 Arabic Textbooks and training of teachers is supported by UNICEF/GPE since June 2015

title.narrative: Items Bank for Grade 9 examinations in Arabic, Math and Sciences developed

target.value: Grade 9 examination administered using the new reliable tools

actual.value: No items bank for Grade 9 examination.

title.narrative: Key policies adopted and being implemented

target.value: Teachers and ECE policy frameworks are being implemented

title.narrative: Restructuring of the MOE adopted and implemented

target.value: Training of about 2,000 MOE, GOEs and DOEs staff completed

title.narrative: Establishment of a sample-based assessment system to evaluate Grade 3 early reading skills at a national level, providing accurate results for each governorate
Learning environment is improved in selected overcrowded schools through building additional classrooms
Number of girls receiving CCT incentives for better attendance and performance increased in the governorates of Hodeidah and Lahej.
Learning environment is improved in selected cluster schools through rehabilitation
New teachers are better qualified due to induction program
Percentage of students at grade 3 in selected cluster schools having acquired basic reading skills
Number of students in selected schools have better learning environment
Additional female teachers are contracted and deployed in target areas
Gender Parity Index (GPI) improved by ten percent in project intervention areas
EMIS is operational at both central level and in the governorates

target.value: EMIS operational and deployed at central and local levels

title.narrative: National Education Vision for Yemen(NEVY) adopted

target.value: National consultation on the NEVY completed and NEVY adopted

actual.value: on hold till the suspension of dibursement is lifted.
